utterance.speaker: RICHIE FALCO
utterance.content: Wait! Please! We can talk about this.

utterance.speaker: RICHIE
utterance.content: No, no!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: A crime is a wrong arising from the violation of a public duty. A tort is a wrong arising from the violation of a private duty.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Okay. I think my brain is crammed to the limit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I think you and your brain are more than ready.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Alexis. Don’t you have a midterm this morning?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m leaving now. Beckett was just giving me a last minute review.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Bye.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Bye. Thanks for your help.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bye. Good luck.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, she’s got an amazing brain. If she wanted to she’d make an incredible lawyer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, like I don’t lose enough arguments to her already. What about you? You ever regret it? Not getting your law degree?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, I’d rather take criminals down than send them up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because with your mind I bet you could have made Chief Justice. You have all the qualifications. You’re smart. You are intimidating. And you look very, very good in a robe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow, really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Care to take a ten minute recess in my chambers?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If it would please the court, I would.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh. I think we’re going to need a continuance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, objection.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Overruled.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ryan. Give it to me.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Sorry, Castle. I’m not telling.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it’s too bad. I already know. It’s John Legend. "All of me cuffed all of you."

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Are you guys talking about the Policeman’s Benevolent Fundraiser?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. The talent competition is on Friday night but he won’t tell me what he and Espo are doing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So how are you guys even going to top the Dirty Dancing lift scene from last year?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah. "Crime of our Lives." Classic Espo/Ryan. Rest assured, as two time champs, whatever we do is going to blow the rest of the field away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that’s only because not being a cop I’m ineligible. But if Beckett and I were competing? You’d be out a trophy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. We’d so take you down.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Back in reality, our John Doe was found this morning by sanitation workers. No phone, no wallet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cause?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Blunt force trauma to the back of the head. Probably a pipe or a baseball bat. Based on lividity I’d say it happened between 12 and 2AM this morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any witnesses?

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A guy who lives nearby heard screams around 1AM. When he looked out his window he saw a car speeding away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He get a make and model?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just tail lights. But he said it looked like a sports car. Ryan and I are going to keep looking for witnesses and street cam footage, but it’s an industrial area so coverage is spotty.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute, I think I know this guy. He’s the personal injury attorney on TV who has the late night ads.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Oh my God, you’re right. That’s uh …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Pitbull.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The Pitbull.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The Pitbull?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Richie “The Pitbull” Falco. Come on. You’ve seen the ads. A guy’s head on a dog’s body. “You in an accident? Take the law by the tail.”

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: “And get a bite at the settlement you deserve.”

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: “I’ll make the law – “

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: “- your b*tch.”

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: “- your b*tch.”

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: “- your b*tch.”

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “- your b*tch.”

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: “El tipo tambièn habla español.”

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why am I the only one who’s never seen this commercial?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Because it comes on late at night, and when you’re not moonlighting, your honeymilk-sipping ass is in bed by 10.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would anyone want to kill the Pitbull?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe CSU’ll get lucky and find the murder weapon. Meanwhile let’s get the body to the morgue and see what it can tell us. Castle, you and I should go to Pitbull’s office, see what we can find there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. Richie’s clients may be suffering but his business wasn’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, there’s always going to be people looking for a quick settlement and plenty of opportunistic bottom feeders like Richie ready to help them cash in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I bet half these people are faking. See that guy over there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Watch this. Excuse me, sir?

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Throw this away for me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry, my aim is a little – maybe … He’s probably legit.

utterance.speaker: ANNIE KLEIN
utterance.content: Sorry for the wait, folks. I’m sure Pitbull will be here any minute.

utterance.speaker: ANNIE
utterance.content: The way he’s been acting the last few days, I – – I knew something was wrong.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How was he acting?

utterance.speaker: ANNIE
utterance.content: Anxious. Paranoid. Before he’d leave the office he’d look out the window. It’s like he thought someone might be watching him. And yesterday morning he called to say he wasn’t coming in at all.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was that unusual?

utterance.speaker: ANNIE
utterance.content: He never missed a day in the three years I worked for him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know what he was working on?

utterance.speaker: ANNIE
utterance.content: He wouldn’t talk about it. I – I asked if it had something to do with one of the cases and he – - he said no, and he um, he told me not to worry, and that it would all be over soon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was he having any problems with anyone? Clients? A girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: ANNIE
utterance.content: He didn’t have a girlfriend. I kept hoping. Look, I – I know what you guys are thinking. Personal injury lawyers are gutter rats, right? But Richie was different. He really cared. He thought the law was there to protect everyone and not just corporations who could afford it. And his clients, they loved him for it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And his adversaries?

utterance.speaker: ANNIE
utterance.content: Sure, people he sued got pissed sometimes. I mean, he won some big settlements, but nothing I can imagine anyone killing for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Klein, I need a list of all of his active cases, along with anyone that he’s won a judgment against in the last few years.

utterance.speaker: ANNIE
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So I understand that Mr. Falco lived in Brooklyn?

utterance.speaker: ANNIE
utterance.content: Yeah. Park Slope.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, his body was found in Hamilton Heights. Do you have any idea what he was doing up there last night?

utterance.speaker: ANNIE
utterance.content: Saint Simon’s is up there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The hospital?

utterance.speaker: ANNIE
utterance.content: Yeah. Sometimes he would make rounds at emergency rooms to see if anyone needed his services.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Got your text. You have something for us?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yep. I know what your victim was doing before he died.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Uh uh. You first.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, I get it. She wants us to tell her about our routine.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ah. You know that we cannot be giving that away, girl.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You are going to have to buy a ticket, just like everyone else. Now, what’ve you got?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Fine. Pitbull spent some time in the countryside. You see this sticky yellow powder on Richie’s pant leg, about ankle high? Pollen from the tussilago flower, also known as coltsfoot. It’s not found in the city, so it didn’t happen here. But there’s something else. Something a lot less fun than frolicking in the flowers.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Those are taser marks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was tortured?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, Lanie says the injuries he sustained were within an hour of his death.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So either the killer wanted something from him, something Pitbull didn’t want to give up -

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or the killer wanted him to suffer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This might have something to do with one of his old cases.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but nothing jumped out from his client list. It’s all slip-and-falls, workman’s comp, insurance claims. Nothing that would explain torture or a trip outside of the city. So where did he go?

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: Mr. Castle? A word?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: As you know, the PBA talent competition is this Friday, and every year we line up a celebrity to perform.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, to help boost ticket sales. Isn’t Kimmel doing it this year?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: He was supposed to. But due to a last second conflict he just dropped out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: And I’ve been told we need a replacement celebrity.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I’ve been asked to ask you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You want me to perform?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: It would earn us both some much needed goodwill down at 1PP.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But what about ticket sales?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett and I would be happy to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: On one condition. Even though I am not a cop, we compete for the trophy.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Done.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, Castle. You really don’t think you have a shot at winning that trophy?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I think I have more than just a shot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You do understand that me and Ryan have been rehearsing for months.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, what Beckett and I have cannot be rehearsed. It’s chemistry. An intuitive bond. Each person knowing what the other is thinking.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, can we talk for a second? Over there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I knew she was going to say that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t you think you should have … asked me before signing me up for this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I thought you were on board? Uh, you were trash talking Ryan about it before.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s before, when I thought there was no chance in hell that we would actually do it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, relax. We’ll just do our routine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We don’t have a routine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on! That thing in the shower? That is delightful.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, That’s not a routine! That’s two naked people singing when there’s no one around to see or hear it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So we’ll add some dance steps, some clothes. It’s can’t-miss.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, guys?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Give them a second, bro. They’re rehearsing their chemistry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan, you got something?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Turns out that Richie was at Saint Simon’s last night and he was not alone.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, so here is the parking lot behind Saint Simon’s. There’s Richie. Now watch this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s a sports car. Like the one seen fleeing the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. And apparently the driver had some kind of beef with Pitbull. He shoves him in the car and drives off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can we make out the plate?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Already ran it. It is registered to this guy. Derek Bolt.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Derek “Lightning” Bolt, the ex-NFL running back?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s a former MVP doing with our ambulance-chasing Pitbull?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nothing good. Check out the time stamp. 11PM. Just hours before Richie was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Leaving enough time for him to be tortured first.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There he is.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Derek Bolt?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’d like a word.

utterance.speaker: DEREK BOLT
utterance.content: Oh, man. Get off me, man! I just –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What, Bolt? You just got benched.

utterance.speaker: DEREK
utterance.content: Finally. Is someone going to explain to me what I’m doing in here?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So I guess you running away from us was, what, exercise, Derek?

utterance.speaker: DEREK
utterance.content: Hey, I didn’t know you were cops. Look, I’ve got some financial troubles, all right? And you two look like collection agents, so my instincts kicked in. You can take Lightning out of the NFL, but you can’t take the NFL out of Lightning, you know?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We know all about your financial troubles, Derek.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, we were just reading about how you got hit with a lawsuit last year after you busted up some guy outside of a club.

utterance.speaker: DEREK
utterance.content: Hell yeah. He dented the Boltmobile. Look, I lost my head, all right? But I’ve left him alone since. Lightning don’t strike twice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except you weren’t so forgiving of his lawyer, were you?

utterance.speaker: DEREK
utterance.content: Pitbull? What’s he got to do with any of this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He won a big settlement against you last year and sent you into bankruptcy.

utterance.speaker: DEREK
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So Pitbull’s dead, Derek.

utterance.speaker: DEREK
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And the last time he was seen he was being shoved into your Boltmobile at 11PM.

utterance.speaker: DEREK
utterance.content: Hey, that ain’t what it looks like.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Because right now it looks like revenge.

utterance.speaker: DEREK
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa. I did not kill Pitbull, all right? Look, dog did such a good job against me in court I wanted him on my team. So I went and hired his ass.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Richie was working for you? Well then, why weren’t you on his client list?

utterance.speaker: DEREK
utterance.content: It’s a paternity thing, all right? My old lady’s just about had it with me so he was handling this off the books.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, but none of that explains your little joyride last night.

utterance.speaker: DEREK
utterance.content: Me and Richie were supposed to meet up with my baby mama and her lawyer yesterday afternoon. Only Richie never showed up and it made me look bad. So I invited him into my car for a little conversation. And he said he was sorry and that some urgent business matter came up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of business?

utterance.speaker: DEREK
utterance.content: Something about settling a debt. He told me he’d handle my thing but he wanted me to take him to some diner for a late night meet. Said someone’s life depended on it. Guess maybe it was his.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So the manager at the 24 hour gym confirms that Derek was working out there during Richie’s time of death window, so he’s not our killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means Derek might have been telling the truth about dropping Richie off a that diner.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. I’ll head over there, see if the wait staff remembers Richie talking with anyone last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It still doesn’t explain where he was during the day. Why he missed work, or blew off that client meeting.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I may know someone we can ask.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo, what happened?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I twisted my knee when I was tackling Lightning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well – are you going to be okay?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ll be fine. I just, uh – I just tweaked it. It’s probably a sprain.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s too bad. I was looking forward to beating you in the talent competition.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, you think this is going to take me out?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Yes I do.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. It’s still on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How? I mean, Espo, you can barely walk.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. And even on one leg Ryan and I are still going to whip your sorry asses. In fact, how about a wager?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, partner, you know, maybe we should discuss –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh uh. If we win then you will dedicate your next book to “Esposito and Ryan, two guys who are funnier, handsomer, and better than me in every way”.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, you’re serious.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And if Beckett and I win?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well then, Ryan and I will call you King Castle. For a month.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Javi – I mean it’s –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What do you say?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? I think Ryan’s right. I mean, we don’t need to make a bet out of this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why? Because you’re chicken?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Because I am a grownup.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. A grownup chicken.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I will also accept Your Royal Highness. You’re on, gimpy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oooh. That’s clever.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I work with what you give me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m going to take you down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With what, your crutches?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can we get back to the dead guy? You said you found someone who could tell us why Richie missed work yesterday.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yes. I pulled his phone and financials. There were no charges on his credit card yesterday, but he made a call. They only call he made from his cell all day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To whom?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Someone he hasn’t called in years. His ex-wife, Elise Resner.

utterance.speaker: ELISE RESNER
utterance.content: He said he was in trouble and needed my help.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, what kind of trouble, exactly?

utterance.speaker: ELISE
utterance.content: Detective, you have to understand. I hadn’t spoken to him in years and then he just calls out of the blue.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You never asked.

utterance.speaker: ELISE
utterance.content: I didn’t want to know. After everything that happened between us I knew I couldn’t’ get involved again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened between the two of you?

utterance.speaker: ELISE
utterance.content: We were at the same corporate firm. It’s how we met.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Corporate law? How did he end up a personal injury attorney?

utterance.speaker: ELISE
utterance.content: He was a superstar. Harvard Law review, partner track. But the pressure got to be too much for him. About five years back he self-destructed. Drinking, drugs, losing all of his cases. Uh, his job. And then finally me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey Beckett. We got a situation.

utterance.speaker: ANNIE
utterance.content: I came back from lunch to find the door half open, the lock was broken, and you can – you can see the rest.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Any idea what they were looking for?

utterance.speaker: ANNIE
utterance.content: I’m still sorting through the mess. But Richie’s computer is gone and there’s something else. All of his case files are missing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would anyone want Richie’s files?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This must have something to do with one of his cases. A client, maybe a witness? Someone or something he was looking into. Something he was hiding, even from you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Let’s canvass the building. See if anyone else saw something. And get CSU down here? Prints, fibers, DNA, the whole thing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me. Beckett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s me. Do you remember that meeting that Richie said he had in that diner last night?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, waitress saw the whole thing. A lot more like a fight. Richie got into a shouting match with another guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You get a description?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Better than that. Waitress knew exactly who he was. I’ll send you a picture.

utterance.speaker: ANNIE
utterance.content: That’s Archie Bronstein, the Savannah Hammer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is there any reason that Richie and the Hammer would be fighting?

utterance.speaker: ANNIE
utterance.content: They were always stealing clients from each other, only Richie was better at it. It got to be where Hammer was so sick of losing business to him that he – – he promised to put an end to it. One way or another.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where can we find him?

utterance.speaker: ARCHIE BRONSTEIN
utterance.content: Call me, friend. Whatever happened to you is nothing compared to what I’m going to do to the other guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Archie Bronstein.

utterance.speaker: ARCHIE
utterance.content: The Savannah Hammer. No case too small, no settlement too big. Now, what can I help you with? Slip and fall? Work injury? Medical malpractice?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re here about the murder of Richie the Pitbull.

utterance.speaker: ARCHIE
utterance.content: Sure, I was at that diner last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, this urgent meeting that the two of you had, what was it about?

utterance.speaker: ARCHIE
utterance.content: I’d hardly call it a meeting. I went in there to get some pecan pie and I saw him sitting there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the meeting wasn’t planned?

utterance.speaker: ARCHIE
utterance.content: Well, maybe he was planning on meeting someone else, but when I saw him sitting in that booth he was alone and we got into it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: ARCHIE
utterance.content: The usual. I caught him here last night trying to poach one of my clients. We had words here and then again at the diner.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Richie was paranoid he was being followed, disappeared all day, says he’s in trouble, then comes here to poach a client?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, Mr. Bronstein, was there a specific reason that he was interested in this client?

utterance.speaker: ARCHIE
utterance.content: He smelled an easy win. Poor girl gets three pieces of flying metal in her heart when a scrap truck ploughs into her car. Now that is a slam dunk settlement, so you bet when I saw Richie at that diner we got loud. Until the waitress told us to take it outside, where I advised him to steer clear of my clients.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what time was that?

utterance.speaker: ARCHIE
utterance.content: 11:45, maybe. Look, I didn’t kill him. I didn’t steal his files. But it might be related to his extracurricular activities.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, what’s that mean?

utterance.speaker: ARCHIE
utterance.content: Richie liked to come off like he was better than all of us, with his Harvard degree and his champion of the little guy act. But trust me, he was into some things.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What kind of things?

utterance.speaker: ARCHIE
utterance.content: Bad things. Word on the street was there was nothing he wouldn’t do for a price. And I mean nothing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. So it looks like Hammer’s not our killer. Apparently after he left the diner he spent the rest of the night “nailing” one of his clients. Anything else turn up missing besides the files and the computer?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, not so far. Here’s what I don’t get. If all they wanted was files, why’d they turn this place upside down?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Must have been looking for something else.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: CSU TECH
utterance.content: Detectives. You need to see this.

utterance.speaker: CSU TECH
utterance.content: We found a false panel in the wall. Take a look.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Rope, duct tape, rags, gloves. Chloroform.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like somebody was planning an abduction.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It might have went past the planning phase.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Glow sticks last, what, 24 to 48 hours once activated? And they’re still glowing?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Which means he must have used this bag within the last two days.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. But for what?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, I just got off with CSU. That rag tested positive for chloroform.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he must have used it to knock someone out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not very lawyerly of Mr. Pitbull.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So wire cutters, alarm schematics, night vision goggles, and glow sticks.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He’s breaking in somewhere. But where?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right, I’ll check the blotter, see if there were any B and E’s in the last two days. See if I can link any of them to Richie’s cases.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, and look into missing persons reports. We still can’t rule out an abduction.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. Hum. Check this out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cities and dates. “January 3rd, 2009. Seattle. March 18th, 2011. Tulsa.”

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Six of them all within the last five years. What do you think that means?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have Tory run this through the database, see if she can find anything. And let’s see if she can trace where Richie was when he made that phone call to his ex.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You think any of this is connected to that girl in the hospital?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, that was a straight up car accident, nothing that speaks to any of this. But someone out there has to know what Richie was up to.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, maybe we should ask Mr. Sampson.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who’s Mr. Sampson?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know, but these are his night vision goggles.

utterance.speaker: MIKE SAMPSON
utterance.content: Yeah, they’re mine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did you know the victim, Mr. Sampson?

utterance.speaker: SAMPSON
utterance.content: Uh, I did work for Richie here and there. Surveillance, information gathering, the usual PI stuff. He came to me a couple days ago asking me to borrow them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he say what he needed them for?

utterance.speaker: SAMPSON
utterance.content: Sometimes he would slip me some extra cash not to ask questions.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anything else you helped him with?

utterance.speaker: SAMPSON
utterance.content: Yeah. He had some questions about alarm schematics.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like – like these?

utterance.speaker: SAMPSON
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about chloroform, Mr. Sampson? Did he you give him that, too?

utterance.speaker: SAMPSON
utterance.content: No. He had chloroform?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Why? What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: SAMPSON
utterance.content: When I gave him the goggles I asked if there was anything else he needed. He said something. I thought he was joking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did he say?

utterance.speaker: SAMPSON
utterance.content: He asked me what’s the best way to get rid of a body.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Get rid of a body?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m starting to think that our lawyer for the little guy did abduct someone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, and apparently killed him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe that’s what he meant by settling a debt.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But what was the debt, whom did he kill, and how did it cost him his life?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We need to check where Ryan and Espo are with that missing persons list. If we can find a connection between Richie and one of the people on the list that should give us some answers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where are Ryan and Espo, anyway?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I think I saw them go into interrogation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who are they interrogating?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, is there another suspect that we don’t know about? What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: OFFICER JENKINS
utterance.content: I’m not supposed to say.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER JENKINS
utterance.content: Or let anyone in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER JENKINS
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are they doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you seeing what I’m seeing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sprained my ass. His knee is fine. Daft Punk’s "Get Lucky". I bet they’re changing the lyrics to “you’re guilty”. Oh, that’s good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, he lied to us just so he could sucker you into a bet, which you fell for.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s going to regret this. Now we have to win.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: With what? Our shower routine?

utterance.speaker: TORY ELLIS
utterance.content: Hey guys, got a sec? I think I’ve got something.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: I haven’t had any luck connecting that list of dates and cities you gave me, but when I traced Richie’s call to his ex yesterday I did find something interesting. Turns out it pinged off a cell tower near Croton-on-Hudson.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s an hour north of the city. What was Richie doing up there?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: I don’t know. But by triangulating the signal off of other nearby cell towers I was able to dial in a more precise location.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Montrose State Forest?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: To be exact, the call came from this parking lot, right at a trailhead into this large wooded area.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: An out of the way forest well north of the city. Now is it just me, or does that sound like –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The perfect place to get rid of a body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know this is a longshot, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If Richie parked in the lot like Tory said, then he would have come down this trail right here. And given how unwieldy it is to carry a dead body – – that’s research, not experience - now then, he wouldn’t have gone very far before burying it. Which means we just have to look for freshly disturbed dirt in this general area like … right here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Like I said. Longshot. Just like our chances at winning that competition.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, don’t think like that. I need my partner to have a positive attitude.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, maybe you should have checked with your partner before signing her up for this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, what’s the big deal? It’ll be fun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, did you see those knuckleheads? I mean, what if I want to be a captain one day, of my own precinct? I kinda need people to take me seriously.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, they do. Trust me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And I’d like to keep it that way. Which won’t be possible if I’m acting like an idiot in front of the entire police force.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, how about this. We do something simple. Dignified. Elegant. Something like, uh … a patch of tussilago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know that one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no. Um, remember Lanie said there was yellow pollen on Richie’s pants from a tussilago flower? Check out this little yellow patch right here, about ankle high.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Richie did bury someone out here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, about the routine. I know you’re worried, but –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s okay, Castle. It doesn’t matter what we do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s the spirit!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s going to be a disaster.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s not the spirit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m probably going to trip, my dress is going to split, the video’s going to go viral –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, now you’re just sounding paranoid. Where is this coming from?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m just saying, Castle. It could happen. I mean, there’s a reason why Captain Gates doesn’t get up on the stage and have fun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just always assumed it was because she was genetically incapable of it. Look, you want me to cancel?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. No. That would just make me lose face in another way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I just hit something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s a body bag.

utterance.speaker: GUNMAN
utterance.content: Put the bag down and step away from the body.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think we may just have dug our own graves.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t hear anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Me either.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s he doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s gone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So’s the body. He stole the body. Why would anyone steal a body?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He must be connected to this somehow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he and Richie are partners. Maybe they killed that person together.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, there’ll be time for questions later. Right now we just have to find a way to saw through these zip ties before he gets back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, well, he took our keys and our phones, so … oh! Wait a minute. As part of my PI training I saw a video on how to break the zip tie cuffs. All you have to do is just hit them as hard as you can against your ass. Ow. It said it might take a few tries.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ow!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This isn’t working.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. But on the bright side, I think we came up with a new move for our dance routine. Too soon? Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sweet!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He stole the body?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Send a team up to those woods to comb for trace evidence and check these zip ties for DNA.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did you get a look at this guy?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was masked, came up behind us, kept us facing away from him the whole time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anything from missing persons? Anyone in Richie’s life that disappeared?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we’ve looked into every disappearance and break-in in the tristate area. So far no connection to any one of them and Richie.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And I, uh, checked with known associates, clients, people he was suing. They’re all accounted for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, somebody was in that bag, so let’s dig deeper.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, and uh … you can lose the limp. We saw you rehearsing. If I might add, it’s no "I’ve Had ".

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well. It’s still good enough to take the both of you down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Come on, guys. This isn’t really about the competition. It’s about doing our best for a good cause, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s about the competition.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s about the competition.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s about the competition.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Whoa! Bravo! And Brava. Wonderful, darlings, just wonderful.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you were worried. See, it’s elegant, dignified, and above all, a trophy winning performance. Am I right, Mother?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, it will be when I’m done with it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: We just need to tweak a few little things, and I do wish you would go for that split.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, well, I will leave you to convince Ginger. I will be right back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, where – where are you going?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am going to call Esposito. I think it’s time we raise the stakes on that bet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What? Castle? Wait.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, darling, don’t you worry about him. Do not worry about that trophy, because the only thing that anyone is going to remember from the final performance is that you sound like an angel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except, Martha, I won’t.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, of course you will. You just did!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, Martha, that’s because it was just you. And Rick. We weren’t in public in front of strangers.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, no. Stage fright.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it’s – it’s more like song fright. I mean, my heart just starts palpitating and I start sweating and my throat just chokes up –

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I know, I know, I know. It’s classic and it’s awful. And why in the world would Richard sign you up for this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He doesn’t know.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, honey. You have to tell him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t – I don’t want to let him down. He wants this so badly, I want to give it to him. But I just … I don’t know that I can.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I cannot wait to see the looks on their faces when they get a load of our routine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I can imagine it. Vividly.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, trust me. You’ll be great.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If it’s going to be so great then why don’t we up the bet? Again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well Esposito, what did you have in mind?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Sorry fellas. All bets are off. I just heard from 1PP. Kimmel rearranged his schedule and he’s back in. Oh, so unfortunately we will not be needing your services, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But we rehearsed and everything.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Out of my hands.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This isn’t over.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys, we got him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That guy who jacked you for that body in the woods. When CSU went up there they noticed something in the trees. Cameras triggered by motion sensors to carry out wildlife census. Guess what kind of wildlife we found?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mike Sampson.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Richie’s PI.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let me see your hands. Now!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where is it, Mike? Where’s the body?

utterance.speaker: SAMPSON
utterance.content: What’s going on? What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Search his place. Espo, pop the trunk.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hands on the car. All right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who’s in the bag, Mike?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What the - ?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sampson’s not talking, about Richie or the dummy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t get it. Why would Richie bury a crash test dummy in the middle of nowhere and why would Sampson steal it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, but he probably told us that story about Richie dumping a body so we could lead him straight to it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, it turns out that dummy’s not the only thing that Sampson stole. Unis found Richie’s missing client files in his apartment. Shredded.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This must have something to do with one of Richie’s cases.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but which one?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, if Sampson won’t talk, maybe the dummy will.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: You do know I’m a doctor, not a puppeteer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, and as a doctor I was hoping you could tell us what’s so special about this … dummy.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’ll tell you what’s special about it. This dummy has been murdered.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Murdered?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: See the holes in its chest?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They look like bullet holes.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: That’s basically what they are. As far as I can tell they were made by small metal pieces projected with significant force.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What would explain that?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’s hard to say. Lots of people use these dummies. Car companies, the airline industry, the military.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So someone could’ve been testing the effects of an IED or a new firearm?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t think it’s a firearm. Three holes, three bits of flying metal around the heart. Where have we heard that before?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hammer’s client. The one Pitbull tried to poach.

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: Last thing I remember was that salvage truck hitting the median before me. That’s when the metal started to fly. The paramedics said that I was lucky. That I almost died.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, Jody, do you remember this guy?

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: Yeah. The Pitbull. He wanted to represent me but I already had a lawyer. But then he wouldn’t stop asking about the accident, like he didn’t believe what happened.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jody, what kind of car were you driving?

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: I’m not sure. It was a rental. Why does everyone keep asking that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who’s been asking?

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: The Pitbull. And the lady who was here yesterday.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What lady?

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: She said he was from my insurance company. When I woke up she was looking at my chart. She asked me about my injuries and wanted to know all about the car.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That doesn’t make any sense. The insurance company would have that information from the accident report.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Do you think you could describe her to a sketch artist?

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. And one more thing: what was the name of car rental company?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: According to the rental firm Jody was driving a Modesto sedan. Now I couldn’t find any safety recalls to explain her injuries, but on a hunch I checked the cities and dates on that slip of paper we found. Turns out that each one corresponded to a Modesto car accident where the driver suffered puncture wounds to the chest.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just like Jody Evans and that crash test dummy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but in each case the wounds were attributed to something outside the vehicle. Road debris, even gunshots.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Give the velocity of the shrapnel, this must be related to a defect in the airbags.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And judging by the holes in that dummy, Modesto was aware of that defect and chose to sweep it under the rug. Richie was onto a cover up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, one that he might have been a part of. I looked into that big time law firm where Richie used to work five years ago before he became the Pitbull. Guess who their biggest client was.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Modesto Motors.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. And Richie handled their account.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, about five years ago Modesto was nearly bankrupt.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So rather than spend millions of dollars to fix the problem they decided that the cost of recall outweighed the potential cost to human life.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Looks like Richie’s conscience couldn’t take it. That problem he had with drinking and drugs started just a few months after that first accident.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That debt that Richie told Derek he was settling, it was a karmic one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He wanted to make it right. Expose the cover up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He needed to prove that Modesto knew about the defect even before people started dying. That crash test dummy, that was his smoking gun.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Which explains the break in equipment. He needed it to steal the dummy from Modesto.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No wonder Richie was paranoid and buried that dummy in the woods. Guys, if the truth about the defect came out then Modesto would be liable for hundreds of millions of dollars in damages.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He knew they’d stop at nothing to get it back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, this is a hell of a theory, but with Richie dead, the files all destroyed, and with absolutely no connection between the dummy and Modesto, it’s just that. It’s a theory.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, it’s more than a theory. We just got the sketch back from Jody of the woman who visited her claiming to be from an insurance company. Look familiar?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Richie’s ex. What the hell does she have to do with any of this?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She was recently poached from the law firm that she and Richie worked at. She’s now lead council for Modesto.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Richie was a threat. He knew where the bodies were buried so his ex-wife decided to add him to the pile.

utterance.speaker: ELISE
utterance.content: I’m not sure why I’m here. I’ve told you everything I know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Not everything. You didn’t tell us you were lead council for Modesto Motors and you didn’t tell us about the airbags.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, those airbags with the habit of putting holes in people. Like Jody Evans.

utterance.speaker: ELISE
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Resner, why did Richie really call you the other day?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was it to give you a little heads up? You know, for old time’s sake. Because that defect he helped cover up back then, you were in on that, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was going public with it and he didn’t want you to be blindsided.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you couldn’t let that happen. Not to Modesto and certainly not to you. So you had him silenced.

utterance.speaker: ELISE
utterance.content: You think I killed my ex-husband? Detective, I had nothing to do with Richie’s death. And by the way, there is no defect or cover up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Richie knew otherwise. In fact, he committed a break in just to prove it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We found that a silent alarm was tripped at a Modesto Motors storage facility three nights ago but when police responded, they were told that it was set off by mistake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yet an ambulance was called there that night to treat a guard for chloroform inhalation.

utterance.speaker: ELISE
utterance.content: I’m not familiar with that incident.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well are you familiar with this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s evidence of your cover up.

utterance.speaker: ELISE
utterance.content: If this dummy was illegally obtained from a Modesto storage facility then it is the property of Modesto and we’d like it back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sure you would. Especially considering it could cost your company hundreds of millions of dollars. Which is why you hired this man to retrieve it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re looking into his financial records right now. It’s only a matter of time before we connect him to Modesto.

utterance.speaker: ELISE
utterance.content: You’re barking up the wrong tree, Detective. Modesto has its own in-house investigators. If we wanted to recover this dummy, as you claim, why would we entrust such a sensitive task to an outsider?

utterance.speaker: ELISE
utterance.content: But I have seen this man before.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where?

utterance.speaker: ELISE
utterance.content: In front of Saint Simon’s hospital. He was sitting in a car conferring with someone else.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Conferring with whom?

utterance.speaker: ARCHIE
utterance.content: Owed a cash settlement? It’s Hammer time. I’ll pound and pound away until I’ve nailed down the cash you’ve got coming. Anyone gets in your way, they’ll have to deal with me. The Savannah Hammer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that what happened to Richie Falco? He got in your way so you pounded him ‘til he was dead?

utterance.speaker: ARCHIE
utterance.content: Excuse me, we’re filming here. Mr. Castle, I will thank you and your ridiculous allegations to wait outside.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They’re not just allegations. Not anymore. Mike Sampson gave you up. A witness placed the two of you together and Sampson was more than eager to distance himself from the murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But he did admit to breaking into Richie’s office and hijacking the crash test dummy from us because you paid him to.

utterance.speaker: ARCHIE
utterance.content: I really don’t know what you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think you do. You knew Modesto would pay millions to get that dummy back. Matter of fact, you were so sure you promised Mike a cut.

utterance.speaker: ARCHIE
utterance.content: This is crazy. I never paid anyone to steal anything and I didn’t kill the Pitbull. I have an alibi.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Not anymore. Once your alibi found out she was facing accessory to murder charges she recanted and admitted that you paid her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We found the taser, Hammer. In the back of your car, right next to that tire iron.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which you bleached. But you forgot about the droplets of blood residue on the carpet. What do you think is going to happen when we test it against Richie’s DNA? It’s over.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what I can’t figure out? Is why?

utterance.speaker: ARCHIE
utterance.content: Why? Because he couldn’t see that that dummy was a gold mine. And all he wanted was justice? You’re as naïve as he was.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go, Hammer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s slammer time.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. Look who decided to show up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSISTO
utterance.content: Where were you guys? You missed the competition.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, sorry, you guys. We got held up giving a statement at NTSB.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you’ll be happy to know they’re launching a full investigation of Modesto Motors.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well it looks like Pitbull’s going to get what he wanted: justice for all the victims of that defect.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. What about you gentlemen? Did you get what you wanted at the show?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, um … let’s put it this way. We’re no longer two time champs.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Three years in a row, baby!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s awesome! Oh, I’m so happy for you guys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, very nice. Very nice. Even though the field of competition was a little light this year.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Speaking of which –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: - isn’t there a certain bet that needs settling?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah... right. The dedication. I guess it’s just a matter of how big to make that font size.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously? Come on, guys. We didn’t even get a chance to square off.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which is why we’re not going to hold you to it. You’re off the hook, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. Thank you. Thank you. It’s very big of you. Especially considering we would have kicked your asses.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh … now, you’re going to talk smack, well, then we are going to settle this. Right here, right now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why don’t we clear all these desks, go head to head. Let the precinct decide.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um… no. You want bragging rights? They’re yours. Our routine’s too good for you, anyway.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s what I thought.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Since when do you turn down a challenge?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, they know we’re better. No sense in embarrassing them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, don’t you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Know what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s why we got pulled from the lineup. Kimmel’s your bud. You must have called him and told him to perform so we wouldn’t have to. Or so that I wouldn’t have to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I … may have overheard you talking to my mother.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You did that for me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No more of a sacrifice than what you were going to do for me. Kate, why wouldn’t you just say something?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I didn’t want you to think less of me. And I really didn’t want anyone else to know, so … stupid.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, not stupid. Just human.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Aren’t you disappointed you’re not going to be able to perform for an audience?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only audience I care about is you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t you know, little fool, you never can win.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Use your mentality –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wake up to reality.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But each time I do just the thought of you –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: – makes me stop before I begin. ‘cause I’ve got you under my skin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: – makes me stop before I begin. ‘cause I’ve got you under my skin.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
